/php/experimental-async-php-volume-2.htm.description: Second try to run a PHP daemon receiving messages from RabbtiMQ and executing commands async on the php-fpm socket

/php/experimental-async-php-volume-2-err.pageTitle: Q/A: Error handling, Retry, Experimental async PHP - VOL. 2
/php/experimental-async-php-volume-2-err.description: Some thoughts about error handling and retry in the system shown in Experimental async PHP - VOL. 2.

/php/experimental-async-php-volume-2-par.pageTitle: Q/A: Parallelism, Experimental async PHP - VOL. 2
/php/experimental-async-php-volume-2-par.description: Why is execution of workers parallelised in the system shown in Experimental async PHP - VOL. 2.?

/php/experimental-async-php-volume-1.htm.description: First try to run a PHP daemon subscribing to redis channels and executing commands async on the php-fpm socket

/php/traitful-configs.html.description: An application specifies requirements for its configuration and subdivedes them into MUST haves and COULD haves. The concept of 'Traitful' configs shows how you can force the user of the application to implement the MUST haves and individually use the default implementations of the COULD haves.

/php/fluent-validation-with-ease.html.description: Free yourself from consuming and redundant data validation by lining up if statements. Use the fluent interface for validating form input or other data objects. The FluidValidator makes it happen and offers flexible capabilities.

/php/custom-exceptions-with-context.html.description: You're tired of creating error lists or objects and return them through multiple layers of your application? Use custom exceptions with context to get rid of mixed return types in methods, handling and enriching errors multiple times on different layers and a restricted, hard to extend structure of error information.

/talks.html.description: Talks I gave at several places

/talks/icehawk-framework-an-introduction.navName: IceHawk - A PHP 7 micro-framework respecting CQRS
/talks/icehawk-framework-an-introduction.pageTitle: IceHawk - A PHP 7 micro-framework respecting CQRS
/talks/icehawk-framework-an-introduction.description: An introduction to the history, features, code and components of the IceHawk framework at PHP Usergroup Frankfurt am Main (PHPUG MUNICH)

/talks/async-php-request-and-reactive-re.navName: Async PHP Request and Reactive Responses
/talks/async-php-request-and-reactive-re.pageTitle: Async PHP Request and Reactive Responses
/talks/async-php-request-and-reactive-re.description: A talk about finding a way to make async PHP requests with the help of php-fpm and eventually get their responses. PHP USERGROUP DRESDEN, Dresden, Germany

/talks/async-php-request-and-reactive-re.navName: Async PHP Request and Reactive Responses
/talks/async-php-request-and-reactive-re.pageTitle: Async PHP Request and Reactive Responses
/talks/async-php-request-and-reactive-re.description: A talk about finding a way to make async PHP requests with the help of php-fpm and eventually get their responses. Péhápkaři 2017, Prague, Czech Republic

/talks/total-recall-the-application-that.navName: Total Recall - The application that never forgets
/talks/total-recall-the-application-that.pageTitle: Total Recall - The application that never forgets
/talks/total-recall-the-application-that.description: A talk about CQRS applied to several application layers and the benefit of adding Event Sourcing for more business intelligence. PHPkonf 2017 in Istanbul, Turkey

/talks/icehawk-framework-a-short-introdu.description: A short introduction to the history, features, code and components of the IceHawk framework at PHP Usergroup Berlin (BEPHPUG)

/talks/icehawk-framework-an-introduction.description: An introduction to the history, features, code and components of the IceHawk framework at PHP Usergroup Frankfurt am Main (PHPUGFFM)

/talks/open-source-software-get-involved.description: A basic overview on resources and best practices to get involved in open source software projects. A talk at the 'X-Mas Issue Bash 2016' at PHP USERGROUP DRESDEN e.V.

/talks/divide-and-conquer-2-years-of-cqr.pageTitle: Divide and Conquer - 2 years of CQRS in production
/talks/divide-and-conquer-2-years-of-cqr.description: 'The MVC pattern solves a problem, that does not exist in the web.' - These few words and some scribbles on the whiteboard has a whole development ideology torn apart in seconds. Mhh, aha, Command Query Responsibility Segregation - Sounds good! And how does one implement this? This session tells the story about the genesis of a PHP micro-framework respecting CQRS, the rethinking of its developers, two years of production experience and the learnings on the road to version 2.0.

/talks/phar-better-tools.html.description: Introduction to PHAR tools, usage examples, how to distribute and update PHARs, PhiVE and PHAR.io

/talks/practical-cqrs-newsletter-double-.description: Why the MVC pattern solves a problem that doesn't exist in the web, how Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) can reduce the complexity of request handling and offers you chances for performance optimizations. A talk at the PHP USERGROUP DRESDEN.
